Html:
Hi there

It appeared to me that the WPF ribbon creates memory leaks when used with default RibbonCommands and code-behind event listeners. I wrote about it here and published a sample along with a possible solution, but it would be nice to get a feedback on the issue from the team - especially in case my workaround is not the proposed one.

http://www.hardcodet.net/2009/04/wpf-ribboncommand-memory-leak

Cheers,
Philipp

Has this issued been fixed on the october '10 release? Anyone knows?

Thanks
